definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
Jiugui Liquor, liquor company from 吉首[Ji2 shou3]

sentences.english: Seryozhka is a sluggard, a drunkard.
sentences.chinese: 谢辽日卡是个懒汉，酒鬼。

sentences.english: Two sots chat:" I am really awful."
sentences.chinese: 两个酒鬼闲聊，“我真该死。

sentences.english: Two drunks were sitting in a bar talking.
sentences.chinese: 一日，两个坐在酒吧里的酒鬼聊起天来。

sentences.english: Then he stepped back and watched the wino bleed.
sentences.chinese: 随后他后退几步，看着酒鬼已经流血。

sentences.english: Many alcoholics go on drinking sprees that continue for days at a time.
sentences.chinese: 许多酒鬼一次要狂饮好几天。

sentences.english: Love of alcohol is inborn and nature to the child of wine bibber.
sentences.chinese: 酒鬼的孩子可能天生就喜欢酒精。

sentences.english: The majority of Sagittarians are drunks or pot-heads.
sentences.chinese: 大多数射手都是酒鬼或者瘾君子。

sentences.english: He was a rounder 's son named Westley.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个的酒鬼的儿子，名叫韦斯利。

sentences.english: The ceremony was the 2008 Olympic Games wine "drunkard" and so on in this archive.
sentences.chinese: 2008年奥运会庆功酒“酒鬼”等就封存于此。

sentences.english: How far should we expect the drunk to be?
sentences.chinese: 我们应该希望这个酒鬼走了多远？

sentences.english: The same can be said of an adult smoker or alcoholic.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的例子就是成年人中的瘾君子和酒鬼。

sentences.english: Xiao-hui xu recovered already became a drunkard.
sentences.chinese: 徐晓辉早已一蹶不振成了酒鬼。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang is not only a chain-smoker but also a heavy drinker.
sentences.chinese: 王先生不仅是个老烟枪，还是个老酒鬼。

sentences.english: The grave-digger is a drunkard , and a friend of mine.
sentences.chinese: 那个埋葬工人是个酒鬼，是我的朋友。

definition: to love wine as one's life (idiom); fond of the bottle
variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
never to touch a drop of alcohol
